publicationStmt.publisher: University of Tennessee Special Collections Library

availability.p: This work is the property of the Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1824 Oct. 31
bibl.note: This is an excerpt from the Cherokee Supreme Court docket for the years 1823 to 1834. The Cherokee Supreme Court convened annually in New Echota beginning on the second Monday in October and lasting three weeks. This excerpt is from the Monday October 31, 1825 session of court. Entries from this Supreme Court docket cover items ch100-ch163.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div1.head: Monday 31st.
div1.p: Court convened agreeable to adjournment Present their Honors John Martin &C Jurors G. Saunders Fore

Widow T Kiuka Ptf
vs
Wolley her step daughter Dft
It is the opinion of the Jury that the Young Squirrel shall hold the property that Quakah Jacks wife contends for, with costs of suit. G. Saunders, Foreman
It is the opinion of the Jury that Cheananna shall have rails split and have a place cleared the same size that she claims of William Reed, with costs of suit George Saunders, Foreman
It is the opinion of the Jury that the Scraper &Co. is justifiable, in his proceedings with Polley Lovet George Saunders, Foreman
Court is adjourned untill tomorrow 10 Oclock
